alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Franklin; Pickaway (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 9:17PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN FRANKLIN, WESTERN FAIRFIELD AND NORTHEASTERN PICKAWAY COUNTIES THROUGH 945 PM EDT... At 916 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Ashville, and another strong thunderstorm was located near Lockbourne. These storms are moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Pickerington, Circleville, Canal Winchester, Groveport, Ashville, South Bloomfield, Obetz, Royalton, Lithopolis, Amanda, Carroll, Lockbourne, Aw Marion State Park, East Ringgold, Duvall, Slate Run Metro Park and State Route 674 at State Route 188. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
